body.p:
Louisville Ky.
Octr. 31st 1863
His Excellency
Govr Bramlette
&c &c
Your Excellency will see the certificate of the Clerk of the Jefferson Circuit Court in the case of the Com. vs. Chas Smith and also the petition enclosed.

You will observe that the names of only eight jurors are attached. They were unanimous in requesting me to petition but before I could get up the petition the Court adjourned and I have resolved not wait
until Monday, but to send it off with the eight signatures and the explanation why only eight appear I was appointed by the Coms to defend for him and found him a very deserving young man. I hope your Excellency will consider his case, which has been presented to you in a hurry and with more informality than it might have been at your earliest convenience and remit his pardon to me if at all possible before he leaves the city
for Frankfort
I have the honor to be your Excellency's humble Obdt Servt
